sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Welcome to Euronews. Now I'm Mariam Zaidi. Here are the headlines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: World Health Organization says Omicron variant is very transmissible, but urges people not to panic with cases continuing to rise, more countries impose restrictions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Trying to contain the Omicron spread, countries introduce further curbs on school children as vaccinations for under 12 year olds gain momentum.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Russia increases its state control over the popular social network VK.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Analysts say the move is significant and symbolic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Yorkshire County Cricket Club's entire coaching staff and its director resign as English cricket tries to move on from the Azeem Rafiq racism scandal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The World Health Organization's chief scientist is warning that while the new COVID Omicron variant is very transmissible, people shouldn't panic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The WHO says that so far it has not seen any reports of Omicron-related deaths.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: They are urging people to be prepared, but emphasised that it's important not to rush to any conclusions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The Global Health Body says the world is much better prepared now than a year ago, given the development of vaccines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Let's also not forget that the predominant variant right now still remains the Delta variant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: So Omicron may be on the rise and we may come to a point where it takes over to be the dominant variant but at this point the very dominant variant remains Delta and we have to protect ourselves against Delta, against COVID-19 and the measures that work against Delta work so far as we know mostly also against Omicron. More than 1% of the German population is

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: currently infected with COVID. The leading Institute in charge of monitoring the pandemic estimates that more than 925,000 people are actively infected with the virus. It's seeing a spike of almost 75,000 new cases every day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Health Minister Jens Spahn says the unvaccinated are becoming seriously ill at a much greater rate than those who've been jabbed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: In Belgium, the Prime Minister has announced a raft of new restrictions

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: to try and stem the spread of Omicron, as hospitals face intense pressure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: All indoor events, with a few exceptions, will be banned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Primary schools and kindergartens also face a range of new measures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Shona Murray reports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In Belgium, with more than one in 50 people infected with COVID in the past two weeks, hospitals are cancelling operations and ICUs are becoming overwhelmed. The government is announcing new restrictions just a week after tightening measures but it's not considering mandatory vaccines like neighbouring Germany. Schools will close early on December 18th in order for teachers to get their booster shots. Large groups will no longer be allowed to meet. Outdoor events such as Christmas markets can still take place but only with the Covid certificate and bars and restaurants can stay open until 11 o'clock at night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The number of deaths in our country is lower than in comparable countries and that is due to the high vaccination coverage. Getting vaccinated is an act of solidarity. 8,000 fewer deaths have been recorded and 30,000 fewer people have been admitted to hospitals in recent months as a result." Meanwhile, Belgian virologist Mark van Ranst has told Euronews that so far, the impact of symptoms of new variant Omicron for vaccinated people in South Africa is mild but this could change given the Belgian elderly population. He says proper ventilation in the future is key as is getting vaccinated. Well if you're unvaccinated and you're not living in a cave there is one certainty and that is you will get the disease. You might escape that for a couple of months but you'll get it. When this Omicron variant really takes hold here in Europe then it will become almost inevitable that you're going to get it. Now when you're vaccinated the symptoms seem really mild and I hope it stays that way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The problem is we don't know yet for sure. That might really help. But if you're unvaccinated, I have only one message and that is get vaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: It'll be two weeks before the world knows the true impact of Omicron, but vaccine producers and manufacturers of antiviral drugs say these can be ready within months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Shona Murray, Euronews, Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: More countries across Europe are now looking to roll out vaccines for children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Austria started inoculating 5 to 11-year-olds last month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: I spoke to Kike Passat, a pediatrician and research professor at the Barcelona Institute for Global Health, who says vaccinating children is critical to reducing the spread of the virus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: We are seeing that the new infections and the new wave are led by infections in children, particularly in children under the age of 12, which are the ones which have not started to be vaccinated. So vaccinating in those specific age groups would have an important toll and contribute to the contention of the transmission globally, not only at the individual level. Now we were just hearing from our reporter there about the new rules coming into place re-COVID in Belgium. Now Belgium has introduced masks for children above six years old. It seems very strong, given what we've been told about COVID, less likely to affect children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: But might this possibly help with cluster transmission?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Sure, sure it will.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We have the experience here in Spain that children are obliged to wear masks in schools since September 2020.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And this led to a very low transmission rate within schools, even before vaccines were introduced in the country. Everything that can be done to limit transmission from and to children is going to help, obviously, in containing transmission at the more general population level.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Sure. I mean, so just to pick up on what you said there about everything should be done to limit the transmission.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: So all of these new restrictions, will they also help ensure the rights of children to having a full and proper education?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And perhaps could these new measures then stop countries sort of whole scale closing schools down like we're seeing in the run up to Christmas. Yes and we have to reflect on the toll of closing down schools in the mental health and well-being of children. Face to face school is a fundamental right of children. They've been subject to many difficulties because not being able to go to face to face school during the entire pandemic pandemic we should have learned a lot about this in the past 20 months we we need to provide the right for them to go back face to face to school and and there are measures and the example of Spain is paradigmatic in terms of how well transmission was dealt with in schools while maintaining fully presential classes during the entire 2021 academic year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: To Russia now, where the state-owned energy company Gazprom has gained control of the

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: country's most popular social network, VK. Critics say the move represents Russia's increased efforts to control online conversations. Matthew in the Cube has more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Well, if you live in Russia, Belarus or another Eastern European country, the chances are you'll have heard of the VKontakte or VK.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The popular social network, which looks a lot like Facebook, claims to reach 90% of the online Russian-speaking audience.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Although it has previously been accused of bowing to the Russian government, it was officially independent, its shares being owned by a holding company of the Russian billionaire Alisher Usmanov.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: But on Thursday those shares were sold to Gazprom, the Russian state energy giant, and more specifically sold to Sogaz, an insurance company that is particularly close to Russian President Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Now Gazprom has said that VK will still remain an independent company, but this comes at the same time as we're seeing increasing efforts by Moscow to control the Russian internet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: They say this is an attempt to combat online extremism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: But critics say these continued moves are an effort to limit public debate and inhibit free speech.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Earlier I spoke to Euronews Russia analyst Galina Polonskaya.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: And she told me that this move to transfer those shares to Gazprom was a significant and symbolic one.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We know that VK is not what it used to be in 2014.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Its creator Pavel Durov had to sell its share.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: He explained in interviews that he had a conflict with the Russian Federal Security Bureau over the privacy and protection of data of the users, he had to leave the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: So now what does this deal mean right now?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Well, some critics say that it is very, very symbolic and means that the Russian state is finally taking a total control over a key part of Russia's social media online space.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Galina, we've previously seen content related to Russian Russia's social media online space.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Galina, we've previously seen content related to Russian opponents on social media networks being limited by the Russian authorities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: How significant is this latest move when it comes to free speech in the country?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Well, you see, Matthew, critics now say that very soon we will see real censorship in the Internet in Russia, which is still quite a free space.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We can read independent media, we can watch independent channels, many of which have been recently labeled foreign agents in Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But we have also seen very alarming signs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We have seen huge fines against Twitter, against Google or Apple.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And during the parliamentary elections, indeed, Apple and Google agreed to remove the application, the smart voting application of the jailed critic Alexei Navalny from Russia's web space.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Many critics are saying that the Iron Curtain in the internet in Russia is ready to drop down any minute and that Russians will have only the domestic content.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And by the way, Gazprom media has just launched a Russian version of the Chinese TikTok.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: And Maryam, following that Gazprom announcement, the CEO of VK has said he will also step down amid this shareholder shake-up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: VK has said he will also step down amid his shareholder shake-up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Russia's ruling People's Party has picked its new leader and he's likely to become the next chancellor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Clemence Waller reports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: All change in Austria as Interior Minister Karl Nehammer looks set to become the country's new chancellor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: He says the decision was made unanimously by the Austrian People's Party executive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Nehammer will succeed Alexander Schellenberg, who stepped down on Thursday after just two months in office.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It is important for me as the new head of the party to stick to our positions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We need to say clearly what is necessary in the topic of migration, asylum and the question about security for the people in our country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Three basic guidelines in the People's Party are important for me.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: These basic guidelines are even more important now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: These are responsibility, solidarity and freedom.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The leadership change was sparked by the decision of former Chancellor Sebastian Kurz to retire from political life altogether.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Kurz and his close associates are accused of trying to secure his rights to the leadership of his party and the country with the help of manipulated polls and friendly media reports financed with public money.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He denies all charges.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: We're going to go to a break but still to come is men's tennis doing enough to support the WTO on Peng Shuai. More on the Chinese tennis star after the break.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Welcome back to the programme.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Friday was another historic day in cricket as Yorkshire County Cricket Club has sacked

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: the entire coaching staff. The move follows the racism scandal with their former player Azeem Rafiq who was deemed a victim of racial harassment and bullying after he spoke about his experience at the club. Well sports presenter Will Dalton joins me now. So Will we've had a real big cull at Yorkshire County Cricket Club. The entire coaching staff is out and its director. Tell us more. Yes Marion they're all gone. They are part of 16 staff who have left the club.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: As you said, that includes the director of cricket, Martin Moxon, who's been at the club since 2007, and also the head coach, Andrew Gale. Now, the new chairman of Yorkshire Cricket Club, Lord Patel, who only took the position only a few weeks ago said that significant change was required and that the club are committed to taking whatever action and steps are necessary to regain the trust that they have lost he said that without making important changes to how the club is run they cannot move on from the past and to become a culture which is inclusive and progressive of course now looking ahead to what steps have been taken hopefully to change the ways of English cricket and Yorkshire itself. Starting there though it was confirmed yesterday that Yorkshire would undergo an independent review into how the club is run and of course the English Cricket Board, the ECB, have announced a five-point plan which they hope to implement to tackle racism and discrimination which they say as well will look into a full review of what they call I suppose a dressing room culture you know cricket culture can of course change but over to a Formula One now ahead of the Saudi Grand Prix you've got seven-time world champion Lewis Hamilton saying he doesn't feel comfortable racing there because of the Saudi Grand Prix. You've got seven-time world champion Lewis Hamilton saying he doesn't feel comfortable racing there because of the lack of LGBTQ plus rights.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: How's that gone down?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Well, I think you can guess it hasn't gone down pretty well.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: But in fairness to Lewis Hamilton, he's not just obviously the biggest Formula One driver, he's one of the biggest sports people in the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: So if anybody can raise some awareness, he definitely can.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And that's why he said, you know, the decision was out of his hands, but he wants to raise awareness of the issues that are involved and that he's hoping to promote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: He did this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: He took a stand in Qatar when it was announced that Formula One would be going to Qatar by having the rainbow flag or a slightly changed rainbow flag on his helmet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: He intends, I believe, to do that again in Saudi Arabia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Of course, this all concerns the whole sports-washing phenomenon where essentially a country will try to host these big sporting events to enhance their international reputation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Now, plenty of human rights organisations, one of them, Grand Liberty, put out a report early in the year saying they had estimated that Saudi Arabia had spent over 1.5 billion US dollars on the likes of snooker, horse racing and golf events to promote the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Now, when Formula One were pushed on this, when they had agreed the deal to go to Saudi Arabia for the first time, they said they hoped that they could be a catalyst for change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: So we'll wait and see how that kind of takes place and hopefully does over this race and the coming years if they return.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Sure, and then Will, just really, really quickly, two races to go, who's going to win? Is it going to be Hamilton?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It has to be, doesn't it, Lewis Hamilton. When the chips are down and his back is to the wall, that's when he performs the best.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: He's won the last two races and I wouldn't be surprised to see him winning the next two, the final two and taking another crown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Well, let's wait and see then, Dalton thank you so much. The men's tennis governing body the ATP has been criticized for not joining the Women's Tennis Association in

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: suspending all tournaments in China over concerns about player Peng Shuai. The Association of Tennis Professionals said Peng's situation raises serious concerns but fell short of cancelling any events in China. The International Olympic Committee says it shares the concerns about her well-being. The IOC says it will be allowed to meet Peng in person next month. Peng largely disappeared from public life after making sexual assault allegations against one of the country's most powerful politicians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Yaqiu Wang, senior China researcher at the Human Rights Watch,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: says that Peng Shuai is not the only personality in China to have been coerced to say that they are well.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: We asked her if quiet diplomacy is part of the IOC, was the right approach for this situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I don't think that's the right way to tackle this, especially not the way that IOC tried to tackle this, which is to participate in the Chinese government's propaganda to construct a narrative that Peng Shuai is free. The Chinese government in the past have disappeared many people and then make them reappear to say, you know'm doing well don't worry about me this fits into the you know the government's past of doing that and then I also to participate in that is shameful now the WTA they've suspended all competitions in China but the men's side that their tennis association they haven't done that so what impact will the WTA's decision really have then well i think the wta what has the wta done is inspiring it says you know human rights is bigger than business we are going to prioritize the athlete's safety over our profit profits it's inspiring it's disappointing to see ATP not following suit. But I think that in the long run, WTA stands well, you know, galvanize other organizations to do the same.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Now, we've seen appearances, of course, by Peng Shuai over the past few weeks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: She's just made another one saying she's safe and well.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: How much credibility can these appearances or do they have really i don't think they have any credibility i mean as i said this happened to many people in china before whether you're the human rights lawyer who criticized the government or it is you're a celebrity a business person who somehow did something the government doesn't like they got disappeared and they say on tv well i'm I'm doing well. But some of them later left China, they recanted their story and they said, you know, I was forced to say that I was doing well. So, you know, this could have happened to Peng Shuai. And so how, you know, just lastly then, how important is it that the international focus keeps on the plight of Peng?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: I think it's very important.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Doing this job for these years, I realized that the attention, the pressure keeps people in China safer than they would have been had there not been international attention.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The government understands that if the world is watching, they need to be more cautious in what they do.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Stay with us. Lots more to come on Euronews now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Welcome back to the programme.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Just as we were all starting to go back to live concerts and events and feel normal again, along comes Omicron to put a stop to all of it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Our culture correspondent Andrea Bollai, though, told me tighter measures and postponements of some events are already happening.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: In England, some of the biggest theatres are now saying mask wearing is mandatory for all performances.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The Royal Opera House, the venues in the West End where Andrew Lloyd Webber's musicals's musicals are playing for example here in lyon there's a massive festival next week the fet de lumiere this is still going to go ahead organizers have said but now you have to wear a mask even though it's outdoors but given that it attracts around 2 million visitors i guess that's not perhaps that surprising further south in montpellpellier, a music festival, Isle of Techno, has been postponed until April. And even in Germany, the Berlinale, the big Berlin international film festival, is exploring contingency plans, possibly including a delay.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Well, let's go to Angela Merkel, obviously. Her choice of farewell song has raised a few eyebrows, hasn't it?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: At her kind of farewell official public goodbye, she had three songs played by a military band, and one of them was You Forgot The Colour Film by the German punk singer Nina Hagen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Should we take a quick listen to it, then?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Let's. Let's do that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Yeah, it's about, I mean, you couldn't hear it from there, but it's about a boyfriend who only packs a black and white film when he goes on holiday to take pictures of the old communist Germany.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: It's a tribute of course to Angela Merkel's East German upbringing. She says, this song was a highlight of my youth. Who would have thought she was a bit of a punk rocker.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Let's now turn to the Turner Prize Honours Visual Art of course. This year all the nominees were collectives were they? Yes that's right, the Turner Prize said all nominees would be collectives who'd helped inspire social change through art and as of course galleries have had such a turbulent time over the last year the Turner Prize said that for once nominees didn't have to have had a major show in the run-up. So it was the Array Collective, they're a Belfast activist group who recreated an Irish pub and won the prize.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Now this pub was decorated with banners about reproductive rights and LGBTQ issues and a list of pub rules including you must have a laugh.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: And that's all for Euronews now. Take care and bye-bye.
